message:
[Action Options]
1) PICK <obj>, Only PICK if gripper is empty. PICK only the correct next item according to the recipe.
2) PUT <obj1> <obj2>. <obj1> can be one of the foods. <obj2> can be food, cutting_board, or table.
3) WAIT, do nothing.
Only one robot can PUT each round. You must PICK up an item before PUT. 
[Action Output Instruction]
Think step-by-step about your plan and output your idea, and then output 'PROCEED
', give exactly one action for yourself, put on a new line, you are allowed to propose only one action for yourself!
Example#1: Dave, please PICK cheese. I will WAIT this round.
PROCEED
NAME Chad ACTION WAIT
Example#2: Alright, Chad, I will PUT cheese on the cucumber and you can PICK ham this round.
PROCEED
NAME Dave ACTION PUT cheese cucumber

[Previous Round History]
== Previous Round# ==
[Chat History]
[Chad]:
Dave has already PICKed bacon, which is the correct next item according to the recipe after cucumber1. Since my gripper is empty, I should PICK beef_patty1, which is the next ingredient we need after bacon.

PROCEED
NAME Chad ACTION PICK beef_patty1
[Evaluation Score]:
The advantage score of Chad's action is 2.988!
The advantage score is high enough.
[Dave]:
Chad, you are correct to PICK beef_patty1 as it is the next ingredient we need after bacon. I am currently holding bacon, so I will PUT bacon on cucumber1 to continue following the recipe order.

PROCEED
NAME Dave ACTION PUT bacon cucumber1
[Evaluation Score]:
The advantage score of Dave's action is 1.036!
The advantage score is high enough.
[Executed Action]
Chad: PICK beef_patty1
Dave: PUT bacon cucumber1
== Current Round ==


You are a robot Dave, collaborating with Chad to make a [big_sandwich].
Food items must be stacked following this order: bread_slice1, tomato2, cheese, beef_patty2, ham, cucumber1, bacon, beef_patty1, bread_slice2, where bread_slice1 must be PUT on cutting_board. 
You must stay on left side of the table! This means you can only PICK food from left side, and Chad can only PICK from the other side.
Only one robot can PUT at a time, so you must coordiate with Chad.

At the current round:
You can see these food items are on your reachable side:
bread_slice1: on cutting_board
bread_slice2: on your side
bacon: atop cucumber1
cheese: atop tomato2
tomato1: on your side
ham: atop beef_patty2
beef_patty2: atop cheese
tomato2: atop bread_slice1
cucumber1: atop ham
Your gripper is empty
Think step-by-step about the task and Chad's response. Carefully check and correct them if they made a mistake. 
Improve your plans if given [Environment Feedback].
Respond very concisely but informatively, and do not repeat what others have said. Discuss with others to come up with the best plan.
Each Chad or Dave's response will get an advantage score. If the score exceeds the given number, the answer will be considered as helpful to the completion of this task. 
The higher the advantage score, the greater the contribution.You can find the advantage score information in [Evaluation Score].
If [Improve Feedback] exists, please revise the plan according to the information provided by it to better complete this task!
Propose exactly one action for yourself at the **current** round, select from [Action Options].
End your response by either: 1) If everyone has made proposals and got approved, output the final plan, must strictly follow [Action Output Instruction]!


[Current Chat]
[Chad]:
Dave, since I am currently holding beef_patty1, I will PUT it on bacon to continue following the recipe order. This will complete the stack up to beef_patty1. You should WAIT this round since only one robot can PUT at a time.

PROCEED
NAME Chad ACTION PUT beef_patty1 bacon
[Evaluation Score]:
The advantage score of Chad's action is 2.894!
The advantage score is high enough.
[Dave]:
Chad, your action to PUT beef_patty1 on bacon is correct. I will WAIT this round as you suggested.

PROCEED
NAME Dave ACTION WAIT
[Evaluation Score]:
The advantage score of Dave's action is -1.949!
The score is low and the plan need to be changed!

[Improve Feedback]
Dave's previous response:Chad, your action to PUT beef_patty1 on bacon is correct. I will WAIT this round as you suggested.

PROCEED
NAME Dave ACTION WAIT
The advantage score score is -1.949, it is too low to run, the answer may contain a misunderstanding of the state of the environment, you must change your action to raise the advantage score over -0.32!
You are Dave, your response is:

Chad, while you PUT beef_patty1 on bacon, I should PICK bread_slice2, which is the final item needed to complete the big_sandwich recipe. This way, we can continue working efficiently without any delay.

PROCEED
NAME Dave ACTION PICK bread_slice2

[Scores]
[Chad Response]:
Dave, since I am currently holding beef_patty1, I will PUT it on bacon to continue following the recipe order. This will complete the stack up to beef_patty1. You should WAIT this round since only one robot can PUT at a time.

PROCEED
NAME Chad ACTION PUT beef_patty1 bacon
[Evaluation Score]:
The advantage score of Chad's action is 2.894!

[Dave Response]:
Chad, your action to PUT beef_patty1 on bacon is correct. I will WAIT this round as you suggested.

PROCEED
NAME Dave ACTION WAIT
[Evaluation Score]:
The advantage score of Dave's action is -1.949!

[Dave Response]:
Chad, while you PUT beef_patty1 on bacon, I should PICK bread_slice2, which is the final item needed to complete the big_sandwich recipe. This way, we can continue working efficiently without any delay.

PROCEED
NAME Dave ACTION PICK bread_slice2
[Evaluation Score]:
The advantage score of Dave's action is 1.022!
